channel.title: Events on BRB Robotics | FTC Team 26502 | Charlottesville, Virginia

item.title: Build, Code, Compete! Lego Robotics
item.description:
FTC Robotics Camp Schedule Overview

Day 1: Build the Basic Drivebase

1:00 PM – 1:30 PM: Arrival and Icebreaker
  • Arrival Activity: Play recorded FTC matches on a projector while participants arrive.
  • Icebreaker: “Robot Introductions” – each participant shares their name and favorite robot.
  • Team Formation: Form teams of two and create team names.
1:30 PM – 2:45 PM: Building Session 1
  • Objective Overview: Goals of the session and the importance of drivebases.
  • Hands-On Building: Teams begin constructing drivebases.
  • Mentor Support: Student leaders provide guidance.
2:45 PM – 3:00 PM: Break
  • Snack and socialize outside.
3:00 PM – 4:00 PM: Build Session 2
  • Continuation of Building and Testing.
  • Mentor assistance and optimization tips.

Day 2: Test and Modify Drivebase

1:00 PM – 1:15 PM: Arrival and Recap
  • Check-in and recap highlights from Day 1.
  • Team discussions about their experiences.
1:15 PM – 1:30 PM: Introduction to Testing
  • Overview of testing goals and its importance in robotics.
1:30 PM – 2:30 PM: Testing Session
  • Drivebase testing on a track.
  • Timed runs and performance observations.
  • Mentor support throughout.
2:30 PM – 2:45 PM: Break
  • Snacks and social time.
  • Team reflection on testing results.
2:45 PM – 3:30 PM: Modification Session
  • Hands-on modification of drivebases based on testing insights.
  • Mentor guidance and encouragement for creativity.
3:30 PM – 4:00 PM: Final Testing
  • Run tests on modified drivebases.
  • Teams take notes on outcomes and needed changes.

Day 3: Compete on the Obstacle Course

1:00 PM – 1:15 PM: Arrival and Final Preparations
  • Check-in and agenda overview.
  • Team huddles for strategy discussions.
1:15 PM – 1:30 PM: Obstacle Course Overview
  • Course walkthrough and rules explanation.
  • Safety briefing.
1:30 PM – 2:30 PM: Practice Runs
  • Teams practice on the course.
  • Mentor assistance and adjustments.
2:30 PM – 2:45 PM: Break
  • Snacks and socializing.
  • Final team strategy discussion.
2:45 PM – 3:30 PM: Competition Time
  • Teams compete on the obstacle course.
  • Timing and mentor encouragement.
3:30 PM – 4:00 PM: Wrap-Up and Celebration
  • Celebrate all teams.
  • Distribute certificates or awards.

item.title: FLL Explore Expo
FLL Explore Expo
item.description: Come check out our local FIRST Lego League (FLL) scrimmage, where teams will battle it out in an exciting robot game! Watch as they put their creativity and engineering skills to the test on the field.
